TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit You_Should_Not_Call_base_In_This_Method extends System.Exception

Docs.summary: This exception is thrown by models.

remarks.para: This exception is thrown in case that your code calls base.XXX when you are reimplementing a MonoMac Model.

Unlike regular classes, Model classes (those that are flagged with the []) are merely a skeleton used to bring to C# the equivalent of "optional" methods in an Objective-C protocol. The methods exposed by the class are not exposed to the Objective-C world, only methods that are explicitly overwritten are exposed.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor() cil managed

Docs.remarks: See the class documentation for information about this exception.
